channel.title: Behance Network Featured Projects
channel.description: The latest projects featured on the Behance Network

item.title: APATHY FOR THE SETTING SUN
item.description: The exhibition APATHY FOR THE SETTING SUN is a collection of new works created by artist Joshua Webb during his time at the Rhode Island School of Design (USA) and whilst living in New York city. The title of the show refers to the notion that if the sun sets over a thousand times in a single day all over the world, how and why does this romanticized and deceitfully nostalgic moment have any significance. Collectively these works embody a sense of the Heideggerian poiesis paradigm as form, provoking an alternative model of finality to construct sculptural and filmic containers that nonchalantly provoke a radical dialogue with the devil as they court an alternative model of finality.
item.content:encoded: The exhibition APATHY FOR THE SETTING SUN is a collection of new works created by artist Joshua Webb during his time at the Rhode Island School of Design (USA) and whilst living in New York city. The title of the show refers to the notion that if the sun sets over a thousand times in a single day all over the world, how and why does this romanticized and deceitfully nostalgic moment have any significance. Collectively these works embody a sense of the Heideggerian poiesis paradigm as form, provoking an alternative model of finality to construct sculptural and filmic containers that nonchalantly provoke a radical dialogue with the devil as they court an alternative model of finality.

item.title: Lacoste Legends
item.description: We were in charge of the Lacoste Legends launching presentation in Argentina. Lacoste Legends brings together 12 legendary collaborators from the worlds of music, media, design and retail, to create an exclusive collection comprising 12 shoes. For the launch event we recreate a newsletter with 12 headlines presenting the shoes and recreate the mainly news in the window display. We also produce a newspaper dispenser and put it on the front of the shop.
item.content:encoded: We were in charge of the Lacoste Legends launching presentation in Argentina. Lacoste Legends brings together 12 legendary collaborators from the worlds of music, media, design and retail, to create an exclusive collection comprising 12 shoes. For the launch event we recreate a newsletter with 12 headlines presenting the shoes and recreate the mainly news in the window display. We also produce a newspaper dispenser and put it on the front of the shop.

item.title: Algoritmo - Artemide Architectural 2010
item.description: Modular system for wall or ceiling mounting to be installed in a continous line or as single luminaires. Full integration with architecture. light interprets the 3 dimensions of space through a formal silence, where matter is just the backstage of light. Three smallsized construction matrices summarize the overall concept of light performance in the same direction: diffused light, direct and indirect, operational, dynamic, wall washer, signal and spot light.
item.content:encoded: Modular system for wall or ceiling mounting to be installed in a continous line or as single luminaires. Full integration with architecture. light interprets the 3 dimensions of space through a formal silence, where matter is just the backstage of light. Three smallsized construction matrices summarize the overall concept of light performance in the same direction: diffused light, direct and indirect, operational, dynamic, wall washer, signal and spot light.

item.title: LIFT International Festival of Theatre
item.description: Summer 2010 saw the return of the London-wide, international LIFT Festival. We were brought in to brand the series of events under one banner; by changing the otherwise static logo into three-dimensional mirrored letter forms we were able to visualise the anticipation of the coming festival through the reflection of movement of dancers and actors within the logo itself. Taking fluro yellow and foil-blocking as constant production values we united a disparate series of communications under a consistent brand style.
item.content:encoded: Summer 2010 saw the return of the London-wide, international LIFT Festival. We were brought in to brand the series of events under one banner; by changing the otherwise static logo into three-dimensional mirrored letter forms we were able to visualise the anticipation of the coming festival through the reflection of movement of dancers and actors within the logo itself. Taking fluro yellow and foil-blocking as constant production values we united a disparate series of communications under a consistent brand style.
